Description: VIZIO, Inc., one of the Largest manufacturers and sellers of internet-connected smart televisions, agreed to pay $2.2 million to allegations by the Federal Trade Commission and the Office of the New Jersey Attorney General that it installed software on its TVs to collect viewing data on 11 million consumer TVs without consumers' knowledge or consent.

VIZIO, Inc. agreed to pay New Jersey $1 million to settle allegations it violated consumer protection laws by surreptitiously tracking consumers' television viewing habits and selling the information to marketing companies and data brokers. This was part of a larger settlement involving the Federal Trade Commission. The FTC also announced the settlement; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-vizio-inc
